title: MP Ruhullah aghast over bureaucratic hurdles for Anantnag event
content: He said the officers of the district need to decide “if they were subservient to the Constitution or the dictations from Delhi”.

title: Election Commission, and no other authority, decides when to conduct SIR: ECI tells SC
content: A direction to conduct SIR at ‘regular intervals’ throughout the country would encroach the exclusive jurisdiction of the Election Commission

title: Kerala Speaker’s office receives letter stating Rahul Mamkootathil remains debarred from CLP
content: An official attached to the Speaker’s office said Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan’s missive was brief and did not attribute any reason for the decision

title: TVK Vijay rally LIVE: Vijay set to kickstart ‘I am coming’ Tamil Nadu Assembly election campaign in Tiruchi
content: After two State conferences — at Vikravandi and Madurai — Mr. Vijay is now hitting the road, projecting himself as a gamechanger in the 2026 elections

title: Security vigil heightened in J&K in wake of Hazratbal controversy and tense Doda situation
content: J&K Director General of Police (DGP) Nalin Prabhat also directed district police heads in the Union Territory “to closely monitor social media platforms to prevent the spread of misinformation that could jeopardise public safety and order”.

title: Chennai-based Unico Housing Finance raises ₹120 crore
content: Unico is a fast-growing housing finance company offering a wide range of products, including home construction loans, home purchase loans, and home improvement loans, among others

title: Heavy rainfall in Himachal village; several vehicles buried in debris, farms damaged
content: About 953 power transformers and 336 water supply schemes have been disrupted in the State due to the recent floods and landslides, according to the State Emergency Operation Centre (SEOC)

title: Rahul Gandhi, Uttar Pradesh Minister engage in heated exchange during meeting in Raebareli
content: The incident occurred during the District Development Coordination and Monitoring Committee meeting held at the Collectorate's Bachat Bhawan

title: Hyderabad drug bust: Accused linked to international drug network spanning eight years
content: Maharashtra police continues to grill the owner of Vagdevi Laboratories Pvt Ltd, Srinivas Vijay Voleti; more arrests likely to follow

title: Case registered over bomb threat email to Bombay HC
content: The High Court administration received a bomb threat email on Friday, September 12, afternoon, which led to the suspension of hearings for nearly two hours.

title: Truck driver booked for ‘rash driving’ after ploughing into crowd during Ganesha procession in Karnataka’s Hassan
content: The driver also suffered injuries in the incident. The police booked the case based on the statement by Manjunath of Danayakanahalli, who lost his nephew Eshwar in the incident

title: ‘Green Girl’ interview: Sarthak Hegde and team on their interfaith romance drama
content: The makers of ‘Green Girl’, director Sarthak Hegde and actors Mayur Gowda and Suchaitha Haritas, talk to The Hindu about their inter-faith relationship drama.

title: Northeast suffered heavily due to ‘vote bank’ politics, now country’s growth engine, says PM Modi
content: The direct rail connectivity between Mizoram and the rest of the country will offer the people of the region safe, efficient, and cost-effective travel options

title: Watch: Mizoram’s first railway in over 75 years: What you need to know
content: Mizoram is now connected to India’s railway network with its first-ever train. The Bairabi–Sairang railway line, spanning 51.38 km, links Aizawl to Silchar in Assam, cutting travel time from ten hours by road to just three hours by train. Built at a cost of ₹5,021 crore, the project features 48 tunnels, 55 major bridges, and the iconic Bridge No. 144, taller than the Qutub Minar.

title: Durga Puja artists of Kumartuli worried over crackdown on thermocol use and looming deadlines
content: Artists and idol makers say they lack the resources to replace thermocol with affordable alternatives

title: Actor and TVK chief Vijay embarks on State-wide tour in Tiruchi
content: The police granted permission for the meeting with a set of 23 conditions, drawing sharp criticism from the actor. Fans and party cadre start pouring in

title: PM Modi in Manipur LIVE: PM Modi on way to Churachandpur  by road amid heavy rain
content: Narendra Modi is expected to lead a roadshow and address gatherings of thousands of people in Imphal and Churachandpur

title: Acquitted 7/11 blasts accused seeks ₹9 crore compensation for nine years in jail
content: Wahid Deen Mohammad Shaikh seeks ₹9 crore for nine years of wrongful imprisonment and custodial torture.

title: Push back involves serious issues pertaining to life and liberty of a person, says Calcutta HC
content: Sunali Bibi a resident of Paikar in Birbhum, her husband Danish, and their eight-year-old son were pushed into Bangladesh on June 26 after being detained by the Delhi Police. Sunali is eight months pregnant

title: 20 custodial deaths in two years in Rajasthan; rights groups express concern
content: Civil rights groups in the State have expressed concern over the custodial deaths and demanded judicial inquiry into each of them and transparent investigation into the cases classified as suicides or medical causes, in order to ensure accountability.

title: India votes in favour of UNGA resolution on Palestine endorsing two-state solution
content: The resolution, introduced by France, was adopted with an overwhelming 142 nations voting in favour, 10 against and 12 abstentions

title: CPI(M) calls for intensified struggles against corporate exploitation
content: Instead of burdening people with higher taxes, the government must provide better facilities, says Raghavulu

title: Myanmar Army Commander Visits Eastern Command, Defence Ties Strengthened
content: India has consistently extended assistance to Myanmar in modernising its defence infrastructure, with both nations promoting technology-driven collaboration

title: Mobile network outage affects lakhs as Hyderabad’s cable clean-up drive intensifies
content: Residents struggling to make phone calls or use cellular data after fibre-optic lines powering 5G towers were cut

title: Former Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa to speak at Manthan on September 12
content: The theme of the event will be the current EC role that is debated in Parliament and is now, a subject of SC litigation

title: Chandrababu Naidu, Pawan Kalyan congratulate C.P. Radhakrishnan on being sworn in as Vice-President
content: Pawan Kalyan conveyed his appreciation to President Droupadi Murmu for gracing the ceremony with her presence, calling it a moment of national pride

title: After the disaster: Punjab flood victims face displacement and livelihood loss
content: Punjab’s floods have taken 55 lives and left thousands of people homeless. Vikas Vasudeva reports on the anxiety around the loss of farm produce and jobs. People in relief camps wonder when they can return home and worry about the condition of their houses and belongings collected over years of work and struggle

title: Shiv Sena UBT, MNS hold joint rally in Nashik, leaders say Maharashtra will now stand by the Thackerays
content: Sanjay Raut alleged that the brutal murder of Rahul Dhotre was orchestrated by workers of Devendra Fadnavis and Girish Mahajan

title: Maharashtra onion farmers launch seven-day ‘phone strike’ over crashing prices
content: Onion farmers directly called ministers and elected representatives to press for urgent relief and fair rates.

title: Ending India’s Russian oil imports is top priority, says U.S. envoy-designate Sergio Gor
content: Trade deal only once India ends Russian oil imports, says U.S. Commerce Secretary; India, U.S. are “not that far apart” on a deal, will be resolved in a few weeks, says Mr. Gor, emphasises Modi-Trump friendship

title: Imposing tariffs for Russian oil purchases ‘causes a rift with India’, says Trump
content: Mr. Trump also repeated his claim that he has solved seven conflicts so far in his second term as President

title: BCCI is anti-national, says Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: If blood and water can’t flow together, how can blood and cricket go together, asks Aaditya Thackeray

title: Over 150 drug cases registered in a day in Ernakulam range
content: Operation conducted in Ernakulam (Rural), Alappuzha, Kottayam and Idukki districts; suspected addictive substances seized; punitive action taken against 182 people for alleged sale and consumption of banned tobacco products

title: Madras High Court orders T.N. government to create buffer zone along 320-km long boundary between forests and human habitations in Coimbatore
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy say humans can develop elsewhere but the flora and fauna cannot survive anywhere but for the forests

title: India backs UN resolution; votes for 'sovereign Palestinian state'
content: India supported a UN resolution backing the 'New York Declaration,' advocating for a peaceful resolution to the Palestine issue through a two-state solution. The resolution, adopted with 142 votes, urges collective action to end the Gaza conflict and calls on Israel to commit to a two-state solution, halt settlement activities, and end violence against Palestinians.

title: ‘Demanded job again’: Fired worker stabs Hyderabad bizman to death in full public view
content: In Hyderabad, real estate businessman Srikanth Reddy was fatally stabbed in Moulali's HB Colony on Friday. The primary suspect, Dhanraj, a former employee fired for intoxication, repeatedly sought re-employment. After receiving money for liquor, Dhanraj, along with an accomplice Daniel, returned and attacked Srikanth when his job request was denied.

title: Shots fired outside Disha Patani's Bareilly house; Goldy Brar group claims responsibility
content: In Bareilly, unidentified assailants fired shots at Disha Patani's residence, with the Goldy Brar group, linked to Lawrence Bishnoi, claiming responsibility. The attack is suspected to be connected to a controversy involving Disha's sister, Khushboo Patani, who criticized Aniruddh Acharya for alleged misogynistic remarks. Khushboo's online video expressing her anger may have triggered the incident.

title: Mizoram's first railway line: PM Modi inaugurates Bairabi–Sairang project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Mizoram's first railway line, the Bairabi–Sairang broad-gauge project, a significant boost to the state's connectivity. The project, costing Rs 8,070 crore, features complex engineering, including numerous tunnels and bridges. This new line directly links Aizawl with the Indian railway network, enhancing logistics, tourism, and daily life for residents.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
content: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: Gujarat high court finds former cricketer Yusuf Pathan guilty of land encroachment
content: The Gujarat High Court dismissed Yusuf Pathan's petition, affirming his encroachment on a 978 square metre plot owned by the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC). Despite a rejected 2014 proposal to sell him the land, Pathan retained possession.

title: 'Oppose this’: Pahalgam victim’s father reacts ahead of Ind-Pak Asia cup
content: Sanjay Dwivedi, grieving the loss of his son in the Pahalgam terror attack, is strongly against the India-Pakistan cricket match in the T20 Asia Cup. He reminded the government of their promise to cut ties after the April attack that killed 26, urging them to respect public sentiment and reconsider sports relations with Pakistan.

title: AI job cuts: Elon Musk’s xAI asks Grok trainers to exit; what internal memo said
content: Elon Musk's xAI has reportedly laid off at least 500 data annotators, impacting its Grok AI training. The company cited a strategic shift towards specialist AI tutors, planning a tenfold increase in that area. Affected employees, generalist AI tutors, were notified via email and had their system access terminated immediately.

title: Goalpost, new balls and medals: Inside India’s Asia Cup fielding session - watch
content: After the Bronco Test introduced by India's Strength and Conditioning coach Adrian Le Roux, fielding coach T Dilip has come up with a new fielding drill to enhance the ability of the Indian cricketers to cut gaps in the field.

title: 'Farce, tokenism, insult': PM Modi's Manipur visit draws Congress ire
content: Opposition leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra have criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Manipur visit, which occurred two years after the ethnic violence. Kharge called the visit a "farce" and a "cowardly escape," while Gandhi stated Modi should have visited "long back.

title: ‘Unqualified to be US Ambassador to India’: Ex-US NSA slams Sergio Gor's nomination
content: John Bolton has voiced strong disapproval of Sergio Gor's nomination as US Ambassador to India, citing concerns about his qualifications and understanding of international policy, particularly regarding Russian oil sanctions. Bolton also dismissed Peter Navarro's anti-India remarks, emphasizing that Navarro's views do not represent official US policy and reflect a lack of understanding of international relations.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; 'threatening' letter sent to CEO
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Chess: Once Gukesh's Hindi translator, Divya pushes World champ off top-10 Rating
content: Gukesh Dommaraju and Divya Deshmukh, Indian chess prodigies, faced off at the FIDE Grand Swiss in Uzbekistan. Their first classical format encounter ended in a draw after a 103-move battle. Grandmaster Pravin Thipsay analysed the game, highlighting Divya's unusual opening and Gukesh's missed opportunities. With the draw, Gukesh, undergoing a slump, fell out of the top 10 in live ratings.

title: 'NE suffered due to vote bank politics': PM Modi slams Cong in Mizoram - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Bairabi-Sairang railway line in Aizawl, Mizoram, connecting the state to the rest of India. He also flagged off the inaugural Rajdhani Express to Delhi and other trains to Guwahati and Kolkata.

title: ‘Whoever the lucky person is’: Tamannaah on breakup lessons; reflects on growth as partner
content: Tamannaah Bhatia is rethinking life and love. She wants to be a great life partner. This comes after her reported breakup with Vijay Varma in early 2025. They started dating after meeting on Lust Stories 2. Tamannaah is currently promoting her new show, Do You Wanna Partner, with Diana Penty. The show premieres on September 12.

title: 'Permission leni chahiye thi': Rahul, BJP MLC argue at UP meet - watch
content: A heated exchange erupted between Rahul Gandhi and BJP minister Dinesh Pratap Singh during a Raebareli meeting. Gandhi, chairing the DISHA meet, instructed Singh to seek permission before speaking. Singh later criticized Gandhi, alleging he acted like an "owner" rather than a chair. Singh, a former Congress leader, also protested Gandhi's remarks against PM Modi's mother, demanding an apology.

title: Indian-origin man beheaded in Dallas: Nearly $200k raised for family
content: Chandra Mouli "Bob" Nagamallaiah, an Indian-origin motel manager, was fatally attacked in Dallas by Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a Cuban national with a criminal history, after a dispute over a broken washing machine. The brutal assault, witnessed by Nagamallaiah's family, has sparked outrage and grief within the Indian-American community, prompting calls for investigations into immigration policies and national dialogue on societal violence.

title: Teair Tart fined $12,172 for slapping Travis Kelce; NFL discipline explained
content: Los Angeles Chargers DT Teair Tart was fined $12,172 for slapping Kansas City Chiefs TE Travis Kelce in Brazil. NFL rules treat open-hand contact differently from a punch, sparking Andy Reid’s frustration. Learn how the fine system works, where the money goes, and what it means ahead of the Week 15 rematch.

title: CBSE 2026: Additional subject scrapped; private candidates blindsided
content: CBSE has scrapped the additional subject option for private candidates in the 2026 board exams without prior notice, leaving thousands of students distressed. Many drop-year aspirants, who relied on this option for JEE, NEET, or career shifts, now face uncertain futures. With the September 30 deadline looming, students demand clarity as CBSE remains silent amid mounting frustration.

title: ‘You don’t belong here’: Sikh woman raped in UK; attackers hurl racist slurs
content: In Oldbury, near Birmingham, a British Sikh woman in her 20s suffered a racially motivated sexual assault and beating by two white men. West Midlands Police are investigating the rape, which occurred on Tuesday, treating it as a hate crime due to racist remarks made during the attack.

title: Singapore billionaire’s decision: Kids bypassed; grandkids become richest
content: Singaporean tycoon Goh Cheng Liang, founder of Nippon Paint's Southeast Asia operations, passed his US$13.2 billion fortune directly to six of his grandchildren, bypassing his children. This unusual move created overnight billionaires, each inheriting stakes in Nipsea International. While the grandchildren receive the wealth, the second generation retains control through voting rights, ensuring continuity and a balanced succession plan.

title: 'Comfort break': UK doctor leaves patient mid-surgery for pleasure
content: Dr. Suhail Anjum, a consultant anaesthetist, abandoned a patient under anesthesia during a surgery at Tameside Hospital in Greater Manchester on September 16, 2023. He went to another operating theatre and engaged in sexual activity with a nurse. A colleague witnessed the incident, leading to Anjum expressing shame and guilt over his actions.

title: Daylight murder in Gwalior: Estranged husband shoots woman dead
content: In Gwalior, a 28-year-old woman, Nandini, was fatally shot by her estranged husband, Arvind Parihar, near Roop Singh Stadium. Arvind, a local contractor, fired multiple rounds at Nandini at point-blank range. Police arrested Arvind after subduing him with tear gas. Nandini had previously accused Arvind of deception and assault, revealing he was already married with children.

title: Powerful quake at Russian coast: Far East hit with tremors of magnitude 7.4
content: A significant 7.4 magnitude earthquake rattled Russia's Kamchatka peninsula, prompting possibility of tsunami warnings for coastal areas within 300 kilometers. The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center cautioned about potentially hazardous waves. This recent quake follows a massive 8.8 magnitude earthquake in July that triggered widespread evacuations across the Pacific, reminding many of the devastating 2011 Japan earthquake and tsunami.

title: Loneliness of being Arshdeep Singh- Why ‘chill guy’ is fighting gruesome battle
content: Arshdeep Singh, despite being India’s leading T20I wicket-taker and a World Cup hero, finds himself sidelined under coach Gautam Gambhir’s regime. From missing out on a Test debut in England to warming the bench in the Asia Cup, Arshdeep Singh is probably fighting the most gruesome battle of his career.

title: Karnataka: Woman kills husband with poison, buries body; fakes 'tiger attack'
content: In a shocking incident, Mysuru police arrested Sallapuri for allegedly poisoning her husband, Venkataswamy, in ChikkaHejjur near Nagarahole Tiger Reserve. Sallapuri then filed a missing person report, claiming he disappeared while investigating a noise outside their home during a power outage. Police grew suspicious after discovering disturbed ground behind their house.

title: Epstein’s emails reveal Maxwell knew of his sexual abuse; Trump mentioned
content: Leaked emails from Jeffrey Epstein's account reveal Ghislaine Maxwell's deeper involvement in his affairs, contradicting her claims of limited knowledge. The messages expose her awareness of Epstein's legal troubles, participation in financial matters, and strategies to discredit accusers. While Trump's name appears briefly, the emails highlight Maxwell's central role in Epstein's network.

title: Beer and booze on camelback: Delhi Police crack desert-style smuggling racket
content: In South Delhi, an unusual smuggling operation was busted where a gang of five men used camels to transport illicit liquor from Faridabad. They navigated through jungles to avoid police, but an informer led to their arrest near the Surajkund border. Authorities seized a large quantity of liquor and the camels were handed over to animal welfare agencies.

title: 'Laid down his life for me, our nation': Charlie Kirk's wife Erika pays tribute
content: Erika Kirk, widow of slain conservative activist Charlie Kirk, delivered an emotional address, expressing gratitude to Donald Trump and the Vances for their support. She vowed to continue her husband's legacy, particularly through Turning Point USA, and spoke of his love for family, faith, and country. Kirk was fatally shot at Utah Valley University, prompting a swift response from authorities.

title: 2+ years since violence gripped state, PM Modi to visit Manipur today
content: Prime Minister Modi is embarking on a two-day tour of Northeast states, including Mizoram, Manipur and Assam, initiating development projects worth Rs 36,000 crore. In Manipur, his visit aims to address the ethnic conflict's aftermath with a Rs 7,300 crore package and interactions with displaced people, amidst tight security and a shutdown call by Meitei outfits.

title: France targets TikTok: Report seeks under-15 ban; teens face digital curfew
content: A French parliamentary commission advocates banning social media for children under 15 and imposing a nighttime digital curfew for teenagers aged 15 to 18, following an inquiry into TikTok's harmful effects. The investigation, prompted by lawsuits and rising mental health concerns, revealed that TikTok's algorithms expose minors to toxic content, leading to addiction and psychological distress.

title: Nepal interim govt: PM Modi congratulates Sushila Karki; reaffirms India’s support
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Sushila Karki on becoming Nepal's Interim Prime Minister, reaffirming India's commitment to Nepal's peace and prosperity. The Ministry of External Affairs welcomed the new government, expressing hope for stability. Karki's appointment followed widespread protests against corruption that led to the previous government's fall. Karki, who previously served as Nepal’s first female Chief Justice, was sworn in by President Ramchandra Paudel.

title: Watch: 'If I could bat with one teammate forever, it would be…' - Gill answers rapid fire
content: Shubman Gill offered a glimpse into his personal preferences and match-day rituals during a rapid-fire session, revealing his admiration for AB de Villiers' scoop shot and naming Jimmy Anderson as a tough opponent. He values winning the Champions Trophy 2025 as a career highlight.

title: Navy commissions new base to support surveillance in Indian Ocean Region
content: Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi emphasized real-time information sharing for maritime security as India's interests expand. INS Aravali, commissioned in Gurugram, will bolster maritime domain awareness and command & control. It will support information centers like IMAC and IFC-IOR, enhancing collaboration and India's role as a security partner in the Indian Ocean Region.

title: ‘Texas was his dream’: Bengaluru mourns Nagamallaiah, beheaded in US
content: Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah, originally from Bengaluru, tragically lost his life in Dallas, where he managed a motel. He had pursued entrepreneurial dreams after running businesses in Bengaluru, including a PG accommodation. Driven by aspirations and family support, Mouli moved to the US in 2018, aiming to establish a South Indian hotel chain in Texas.

title: 9 dead, 22 injured as truck ploughs into Ganpati procession in Karnataka's Hassan
content: A tragic incident occurred in Karnataka's Hassan district. A tanker lorry crashed into a Ganpati immersion procession in Mosale Hosalli village. Nine people died, including villagers and engineering students. Over twenty individuals sustained injuries and are receiving medical care. Chief Minister Siddaramiah announced compensation for the victims' families. Former Chief Minister Kumaraswamy expressed grief.

title: 'Erratic behaviour': Ex-US NSA slams Trump’s India tariffs; rejects India-Pak peace claim
content: John Bolton has criticized Donald Trump's tariff policy on India as inappropriate, warning it could strain relations. He also refuted Trump's claim of brokering peace between India and Pakistan. Bolton highlighted the erratic nature of imposing tariffs on India for Russian purchases while overlooking larger buyers like China, advising India to prioritize long-term ties with the US and view Trump's actions as temporary.

title: Not all heart attacks are sudden- this hidden artery threat is to blame
content: This is a silent killer. It slowly narrows arteries with plaque. This leads to heart problems. Lifestyle, medical issues, and genes contribute. Early detection is key. Doctors use tests like lipid profiles. Changes in diet and exercise help. Quitting smoking is crucial. Managing stress is also important. Control diabetes and blood pressure. These steps reduce heart attack risk.

title: ‘Tariffs on China, India’: US treasury urges EU, G7; says Russian oil buys funding war
content: The US Treasury is pushing G7 and EU partners to impose tariffs on Chinese and Indian imports of Russian oil, aiming to cut off funding for Putin's war in Ukraine. While Trump has already levied tariffs on Indian goods, he's hesitant to do the same with China due to trade sensitivities.

title: INS Aravali Commissioned as Navy’s new nerve centre in Gurugram
content: Named after the steadfast Aravali Range, the base will support command, control and Maritime Domain Awareness (MDA) operations

title: Watch: For the first time, Chennai builds elevated corridor above metro tunnels
content: For the first time, Chennai is constructing an elevated four-lane corridor directly above underground Metro tunnels between Teynampet and Saidapet, ensuring the twin tunnels remain completely safe.

title: Motorist dies after SUV laden with red sanders hits him
content: Police searched the vehicle and found 15 wooden logs of red sanders that weighed over 500 kg and worth around ₹ 20 lakh.

title: Watch: Ground report: Manipur prepares for PM Modi’s visit amid ethnic crisis
content: The visit comes over two years after deadly ethnic violence between Kuki and Meitei communities left over 260 dead and thousands homeless. The Hindu Deputy Editor Vijaita Singh reports on the ongoing situation and the political context surrounding Modi’s visit.

title: AIADMK alleges discrepancies in elector database of Chepauk-Thiruvallikeni Assembly constituency
content: The party found 1,722 electors, whose names figured in the electoral rolls, were not ‘physically present’ at the mentioned addresses

title: A new railway line to redefine the Northeast
content: The 51.38-kilometre railway line linking Bairabi station to the newly built Sairang station near to Mizoram’s capital Aizawl will mark a major milestone for the Northeast Frontier Railway and also signals the Indian government’s broader plan to extend railway connectivity all the way to the Myanmar border

title: Supreme Court asks Seeman to apologise to woman or face dismissal of his petition to quash criminal proceedings
content: The court extends the interim stay on the investigation against the NTK chief coordinator till the next date of hearing

title: Kerala government to release GCC policy shortly
content: Government intends to offer incentives to encourage companies that wish to start global capability centres in State, says CM

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear plea alleging minor’s sexual assault, custodial torture by Gujarat police
content: The plea has sought the setting up of a Special Investigation Team excluding Gujarat cadre officers or a court-monitored CBI probe

title: Anbumani Ramadoss may push for caste census as condition for alliance for 2026 Assembly election
content: While senior party leaders backing Dr. Anbumani believe that AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami could be as reluctant as the DMK to support 10.5% separate reservations for Vanniyars due to counter-polarisation, there is belief that the PMK could convince potential alliance partners to guarantee the conduct of a caste-census

title: India’s manuscripts reflect the journey of humanity, says Modi
content: PM says digitisation will curb intellectual piracy; he bats for creation of database and highlights collaboration with Thailand, Vietnam, Mongolia

title: Railways issue alert after cable cuts trigger signal failures, safety concerns
content: ‘Repeated signal failures pose serious threat to the safety of train services, and can lead to catastrophic consequences if precautions are not taken’

title: Six workers killed in an accident at a stone quarry in West Bengal’s Birbhum
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari claimed that stone quarries operating in the Birbhum and adjoining districts are already under the scanner for misuse of explosives by the NIA

title: Bihar Congress draws BJP’s ire over AI video of Modi and his mother
content: Posted on X on Wednesday, the AI-generated clip depicts the PM’s mother as appearing in his dream and rebuking his politics. As the BJP and its leaders target Rahul Gandhi and the Congress, the Congress’s media and publicity head Pawan Khera says there’s nothing disrespectful in the clip.

title: Japan’s Hosoda to invest ₹882 crore in Karnataka to set up a solar cell unit
content: MP Patil-led business exploratory delegation to Japan to bring in multiple new investments to Karnataka

title: Odisha man steals TNSTC bus from Chennai, caught in Andhra Pradesh
content: He rode away a brand new air-conditioned bus from a depot near the Chennai Mofussil Bus Terminus at Koyambedu. It was later tracked near Nellore with the help of the GPS fitted onboard

title: Supreme Court says time-barred sexual harassment complaint must ‘haunt’ Vice-Chancellor forever
content: Top court directs Vice-Chancellor of WBNUJS Nirmal Kanti Chakrabarti to append judgment to his resume

title: Mandatory reflective stickers for cars to reduce road accidents
content: ‘Heavy vehicles moving at low speeds, and parked on the road, coupled with poor visibility lead to smaller vehicles crashing into them at night time’

title: Karnataka notifies cap on cinema ticket at ₹200 for all cinemas and for all languages
content: A similar exercise was attempted by the Siddaramaiah government in 2017, which came to a halt after the Multiplex Association of India challenged successfully against the move in court

title: Action taken against HYDRAA staff responsible for open manhole
content: Orders have been issued for demotion of the two supervisors, and the MET contractor has been asked to dismiss the two outsourced workers, a statement from HYDRAA informed, affirming that a thorough enquiry has been conducted.

title: BMRCL cites State govt.’s shadow cash support withdrawal to seek metro fare hike in FFC report
content: In its proposal to the committee, BMRCL stated that until now, the State government had been providing SCS through budgetary allocations

title: Supreme Court seeks Centre, ECI response on plea to regulate political parties
content: The petition relies on recent income tax raids to underscore how political outfits are allegedly being used as vehicles for laundering unaccounted wealth

title: Heavy rain disrupts life Vizianagaram, Srikakulam district
content: Two hour rains disrupts life in two North Andhra cities; flooding, damaged roads trouble motorist; Srikakulam District Collector directs officials to monitor inflows into the Vamsadhara, Nagavali, and other rivers

title: Death due to suspected drug overdose: police recover skeletal remains of victim
content: The skeletal remains of Vijil Vijayan, who reportedly died of drug overdose six years ago, were recovered after a five-day intensive search

title: Tigers ace Skubal exits start, to undergo imaging
content: Tigers star left-hander Tarik Skubal left the club's 8-2 loss to the Marlins in the fourth inning Friday night after experiencing tightness in his left side, according to the team.

title: 'Special': Judge slugs 362nd HR to pass DiMaggio
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge hit his 362nd home run Friday night, breaking a tie with Joe DiMaggio and taking sole possession of fourth place on the franchise's career list.

title: Hill: Focus is on football not abuse allegations
content: Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill declined to comment on his divorce case Friday, saying he is only focused on his job and providing for his family.

title: 49ers rule out QB Purdy; Jones to start vs. Saints
content: Mac Jones will start against the Saints on Sunday after San Francisco 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan officially announced that Brock Purdy will not play in New Orleans.

title: Source: Chargers' Tart fined for slapping Kelce
content: Chargers defensive tackle Teair Tart has been fined by the NFL for slapping Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce in their Week 1 game, a source told ESPN.

title: Sources: ACC ref, irked by replay handling, quits
content: Gary Patterson, frustrated by the handling of a replay review during the UConn-Syracuse game last week, abruptly terminated his contract with the conference after the contest, sources told ESPN.

title: GM: Sky keeping Reese despite late-season strife
content: Chicago Sky general manager Jeff Pagliocca said Friday that he expects star Angel Reese to remain a member of the team despite late-season friction between the two sides.

title: Fore! Daly shoots a record-high 19 on way to 88
content: John Daly is in the PGA Tour Champions record book for the highest score on a hole. He made a 19 in the first round of the Sanford International.

title: 🏀 Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clips partner

title: PM Modi Reaches Manipur, His First Visit Since 2023 Ethnic Violence: 10 Points
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Manipur in what is his first visit to the state since ethnic violence erupted there in 2023. He landed in Imphal from Aizawl in Mizoram and is now travelling to Churachandpur.

title: PM Modi In Manipur LIVE Updates: PM Arrives In Imphal, First Visit To State Since 2023 Violence
content: PM Narendra Modi Manipur Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Manipur on Saturday, his first trip to the northeastern state since ethnic violence broke out two years ago.

title: "I Am Alive": Woman Who Flew Thar Out Of Delhi Showroom's 1st Floor On Rumours
content: The accident reportedly took place when Maani Pawar was performing a customary ritual inside the showroom before taking it out on the road.

title: "Lifeline Of Transformation": PM Modi Launches Mizoram's First Railway Line
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation and inaugurated multiple development projects worth over Rs 9,000 crore virtually in Mizoram on Saturday. He also inaugurated the 51.38-km Bairabi-Sairang railway project and three new trains.

title: Sikh Woman Raped By 2 Men In UK, Told "Go Back To Your Country"
content: A Sikh woman in her twenties was raped by two men and was subjected to racist remarks in the UK's Oldbury town.

title: Actor Vijay Begins Mega Statewide Campaign For 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly Polls
content: Tamil actor-turned-politician Vijay launched the TVK's first-ever election campaign tour from Tiruchi on Saturday, marking a crucial moment in the run-up to the 2026 Assembly polls.

title: Breakthrough In Murder Case In Which Thieves Took Shower Before Fleeing
content: In a big breakthrough, Hyderabad police have arrested the two men suspected of killing a 50-year-old woman at her Cyberabad home and looting gold worth lakhs.

title: At 160 Kmph, Namo Bharat On Delhi-Meerut Corridor Surpasses Vande Bharat To Become India's Fastest Train
content: The Namo Bharat train, operating at its highest speed of 160 kmph on the 55-km section of Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System, has become the fastest running train in the country.

title: North Korea Executes People For Sharing Foreign Films, TV Series: UN Report
content: North Korea has executed people for distributing foreign media, including television shows like popular South Korean dramas, as part of an intensifying crackdown on personal freedoms, a U.N. human rights report said on Friday.

title: Authorities Lift Curfew In Nepal, Daily Life Gradually Returns To Normal After 5 Days
content: Authorities on Saturday lifted the curfew and restrictive orders imposed in Kathmandu Valley and other parts of Nepal, allowing daily life to gradually return to normal.

title: Magnitude 7.4 Earthquake Strikes Russia's Kamchatka, Tsunami Warning Lifted
content: The earthquake hit 111 kilometres east of the Russian city of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, the administrative centre of the Kamchatka region, at a depth of 39.5 kilometres.

title: Who Is Tyler Robinson, 22-Year-Old Suspect In Charlie Kirk's Murder
content: Tyler Robinson had scored in the top percentile on his college entrance exam and earned himself a four-year scholarship to Utah State University in Logan.

title: New Drainage Plan Promises Flood-Free, Sustainable Delhi
content: Delhi may soon have a long-term answer to its waterlogging woes. The city government has cleared a futuristic Storm Water Drainage Master Plan, prepared by the Public Works Department (PWD), aimed at making the capital more resilient to flooding

title: "India Committed To Nepal's Progress": PM Modi Congratulates New Nepal PM Sushila Karki
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has congratulated Sushila Karki on assuming charge as the interim prime minister of Nepal following deadly protests that toppled the earlier KP Oli government last week.

title: Man Who Beheaded Indian National At US Motel Faces Deportation
content: Two days after Chandra Nagamallaiah was murdered by an undocumented immigrant from Cuba, the US Department of Homeland Security  announced that ICE has started the process of the attacker's "removal" from the country.

title: Man Who Killed Indian Should Not Have Been Free On US Streets: Congressman
content: The accused behind the beheading of an Indian man at a motel in the US city of Dallas was earlier arrested on several charges and should not have been freed, Indian-origin Congressman Ro Khanna said on Saturday.

title: UP Man Records Videos Before Taking His Life, Alleges Harassment By Wife, In-Laws
content: A 40-year-old man from Meerut died by suicide after allegedly facing continuous harassment from his wife and in-laws, police said on Friday.

content: Days before the protests, many had rushed to VPN services -- or virtual private networks -- to evade blocks on platforms.

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to embark on a three-day visit from September 13 to Mizoram, Manipur, Assam, West Bengal and Bihar to launch multi-crore infrastructure projects.

title: 'He threw the freakin' shoe!': Revisiting Marco Wilson's infamous toss five years later
content: college football's Marco Wilson throws an LSU player's shoe in the fourth quarter of a rivalry game on Dec. 12, 2020 . the throw, which came in a tie game against a heavy underdog, certainly cost Florida a win . five years later, the play proved a turning point in the history of an once-proud Florida program .

title: Best of NFL Week 2's tunnel fits, featuring Micah Parsons' velvet suit
content: Week 2 of the NFL regular season is here and the stars are ushering it in with style. NFL players take the pregame tunnels each week ahead of their respective matchups, showcasing their own styles in tailored suits, streetwear and designer clothing. Ahead of "Thursday Night Football,"  Green Bay Packers  cornerback  Micah Parsons  came ready for business in a velvet double-breasted suit.
